docs.snippet: The White House event on Thursday will focus on money for research and aim to start a national conversation about the dangers of sports-related head injuries, especially among young people....
docs.lead_paragraph: The White House event on Thursday will focus on money for research and aim to start a national conversation about the dangers of sports-related head injuries, especially among young people.
docs.abstract: Pres Obama will host a day-long summit at the White House seeking to elevate a national conversation about the dangers of sports-related head injuries, especially among young people, by pushing for more medical research and more funding for public awareness campaigns.

byline.original: By MICHAEL D. SHEAR and KEN BELSON

docs.snippet: Mr. Glazer’s teams won championships in the N.F.L. and the English Premier League....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Glazer’s teams won championships in the N.F.L. and the English Premier League.
docs.abstract: Malcolm Glazer, the owner of the NFL's Tampa Bay Buccaneers and the renowned English soccer club Manchester United, dies at age 85.

headline.main: Malcolm Glazer, Owner of Buccaneers and Manchester United, Is Dead at 85
headline.print_headline: Malcolm Glazer, Owner of Buccaneers And Manchester United, Is Dead at 85

docs.snippet: At his arraignment, Aaron Hernandez pleaded not guilty to all seven charges in the deaths of two Cape Verdean immigrants in July 2012....
docs.lead_paragraph: At his arraignment, Aaron Hernandez pleaded not guilty to all seven charges in the deaths of two Cape Verdean immigrants in July 2012.
docs.abstract: Former New England Patriots tight end Aaron Hernandez pleads not guilty to all seven charges, including two charges of first-degree murder, stemming from the 2012 shooting deaths of Cape Verdean immigrants Daniel Abreu and Safiro Furtado in Boston; Hernandez is due in court again June 24.

headline.main: Prosecutor Says Bump at Club Led to Shootings

docs.snippet: KAVANAGH--Joseph P.,of Huntington, NY, passed away on May 27, 2014, at the age of 74. Born in Queens, NY, to Joseph and Francis Kavanagh. He lived most of his life on Long Island. Joe was proud to have been a Naval Officer and part of the military...
docs.lead_paragraph: KAVANAGH--Joseph P.,of Huntington, NY, passed away on May 27, 2014, at the age of 74. Born in Queens, NY, to Joseph and Francis Kavanagh. He lived most of his life on Long Island. Joe was proud to have been a Naval Officer and part of the military family. He subsequently worked most of his professional career in the banking industry, and earned the title of Senior Vice President before retiring. In his spare time he enjoyed doing crossword puzzles, playing golf and watching TV; especially Jeopardy, C-SPAN, golf, baseball and football. Beloved father of Marie (Lennon), Patricia (Edwards) and Joseph Kavanagh Jr. Joe was an extremely proud grandfather ("Poppi" or "Hampa") of Patrick Lennon, Alexa Edwards, Lindsey Lennon, Elisa Lennon and Michael Lennon. He is also survived by the mother of his children, Maria; his brother Edward; his sister Margaret; as well as many loving cousins, nieces, nephews, and other friends. Family and friends may visit at M.A. Connell Funeral Home, 934 New York Avenue, Huntington Station, on Friday, 2 to 4pm and 7 to 9pm. Mass on Saturday 9:30am at St. Patrick's Church, Huntington, NY. Interment St. Patrick's Cemetery.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  KAVANAGH, JOSEPH P.
